intro: Mariscus philippensis, commonly known as the Philippine mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and hairy, ovate leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
